derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French camahieu, cama(h)u; later influenced by Italian cam(m)eo, from medieval Latin cammaeus, related to the Old French word

entry.tran: 精彩描写;小品文;精彩片断
entry.def: A cameo is a short description or piece of acting which expresses cleverly and neatly the nature of a situation, event, or person's character.

example.ex: ...a succession of memorable cameos of Scottish history...
example.tran: 一系列反映苏格兰历史的令人难忘的精彩片断

example.ex: He played a cameo role, that of a young Aids patient in hospital.

entry.tran: (通常为椭圆形的)多彩浮雕首饰
entry.def: A cameo is a piece of jewellery, usually oval in shape, consisting of a raised stone figure or design fixed on to a flat stone of another colour.

means.word_mean: 1. engraving or carving in low relief on a stone (as in a brooch or ring)
